Uses of Class
com.ibm.watson.dsm.util.AbstractListenerManager

  • Packages that use AbstractListenerManager 
    Package Description
    com.ibm.watson.dsm.engine
    Provides a framework for rule evaluation over data shared from within database tables.
    com.ibm.watson.dsm.engine.analysis
    Provides a concrete rules engine that generates all possible end tuple states that can result from a rule evaluation.
    com.ibm.watson.dsm.engine.app
    Provides a concrete rules engine that uses the SharedTuplePlatform to exchange tuples between engines.
    com.ibm.watson.dsm.services.gaian
    Provides a distributed neighbor monitoring system for the gaian database nodes.

    • Uses of AbstractListenerManager in com.ibm.watson.dsm.engine

      Subclasses of AbstractListenerManager in com.ibm.watson.dsm.engine 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  AbstractRuleEngine
      A tuple application that processes notification of tuple changes (that is, additions or deletions) according to a set of rules.

    • Uses of AbstractListenerManager in com.ibm.watson.dsm.engine.analysis

      Subclasses of AbstractListenerManager in com.ibm.watson.dsm.engine.analysis 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  AnalysisEngine
      Provide a pseudo-RuleEngine that evaluations rules against inputs to produce the set of all possible end tuple states.

    • Uses of AbstractListenerManager in com.ibm.watson.dsm.engine.app

      Subclasses of AbstractListenerManager in com.ibm.watson.dsm.engine.app 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  DSMEngine
      Extends the super class to use SharedTuplePlatform to implement the exchange of transport tuples between platforms, and thus engines.

    • Uses of AbstractListenerManager in com.ibm.watson.dsm.services.gaian

      Subclasses of AbstractListenerManager in com.ibm.watson.dsm.services.gaian 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  GaianRuleEngine
      This extends the superclass only to override GaianRuleEngine.evaluateTupleRules(boolean, com.ibm.watson.dsm.platform.tuples.ITupleSet...) so as to capture the injection of a reset tuple which we want to cause all tables to be cleared.
